abstract.p: Employees at Vasp, large and heavily indebted Brazilian airline, postpone strike after company officials agreed to address union demands for government intervention; union wants airline restructured, and removal of majority shareholder, Wagner Canhedo (S)

block.p: Employees at Vasp, a large and heavily indebted Brazilian airline, postponed a daylong strike after company officials agreed to address union demands for government intervention. The national airline employee's union wants the airline restructured, and Wagner Canhedo, Vasp's majority shareholder, removed as president. In the last six months, Vasp has returned 17 aircraft to creditors and dismissed almost half of its 8,000 employees to try to reduce its $1.5 billion debt. In an effort to hold off the strike, Mr. Canhedo agreed to pay all wages and pension fund contributions until the end of August.
